page.title: 09FISHING
page.content: MOST OF THE FISHERMEN IN ST ABBS ARE INSHORE FISHERS. THEY GO OUT EVERY DAY TO CATCH LOBSTERS AND CRABS. TO DO THIS THEY USE CRIBS. CRIBS ARE MADE OF WOOD AND NET. THEY ARE SHAPED LIKE A TUNNEL WITH THE NET STRETCHED OVER THE HOOPS OF WOOD AND METAL.THERE ARE TWO HOLES ON EACH SIDE OF THE CRIB FOR THE SHELLFISH TO GO IN. THEY CANT GET OUT AS THE HOLE SLOPES UP. THE CRIBS ARE BAITED WITH ROTTEN FISH. USUALLY IN A SMALL BOAT THEY SHOOT A FLEET OF 35 CRIBS BUT THERE CAN BE AS MANY AS 65 IN A FLEET.MOST FISHERMEN SHOOT 3 FLEETS OF CRIBS.FROM ONE SHOOT THAY CAN GET CATCH 3 BOXES OF LOBSTER AND 5 BOXES OF CRABS. IF THEY CATCH SOME FISH IN THE CRIBS THEY CAN USE IT FOR BAITING THE NEXT FLEET.THE BEST TIME FOR CATCHING LOBSTERS IS IN AUTUMN.
